writing.name: CONTINUE
writing.text: Continue

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_CLASSROOM_DIALOGUE_01
writing.text: Who said 'There are 10 kinds of people in the world: those who understand binary numberals, and those who don't?

writing.name: LISTEN_ASH
writing.text: Listen to Ash.

writing.name: LISTEN_MAX
writing.text: Listen and to Max.

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_CLASSROOM_DIALOGUE_02
writing.text: Ian Steward!

writing.name: APPROACH_MAX
writing.text: You had fun in the trivia but you didn't know the answer. The bell rings and while you're in the hallway. You turn towards Max.

writing.name: APPROACH_ASH
writing.text: You had fun in the trivia but you didn't know the answer. The bell rings and while you're in the hallway. You turn towards Max.

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_HALLWAY_DIALOGUE_03
writing.text: You: Whoa... you knew the answer...

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_HALLWAY_DIALOGUE_04
writing.text: You: How did you know the answer?! I should brush up on my trivia...

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_HALLWAY_DIALOGUE_05
writing.text: You: Do you spend all your free time watching Jeoporady at home...?

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_HALLWAY_DIALOGUE_ASH01
writing.text: Ash: Not really... I had a job since I was young.

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_HALLWAY_DIALOGUE_ASH02
writing.text: Ash: ... but I left...um...I....

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_HALLWAY_DIALOGUE_ASH03
writing.text: You: Oh, I didn't know that, I'm sorry.

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_HALLWAY_DIALOGUE_ASH04
writing.text: You: You: You wanna hangout after school? We can go somewhere happy...like the arcade!

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_HALLWAY_DIALOGUE_ASH05
writing.text: Ash: Heck yeah!!

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_HALLWAY_DIALOGUE_MAX01
writing.text: Max: I just had a lot of spare time...

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_HALLWAY_DIALOGUE_MAX02
writing.text: Max: I was kinda isolated for being weird...

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_HALLWAY_DIALOGUE_MAX03
writing.text: Max: ... I did have a best friend... but he left because of something I said...

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_HALLWAY_DIALOGUE_MAX04
writing.text: You: Oh I'm so sorry I didn't know. ...

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_HALLWAY_DIALOGUE_MAX05
writing.text: You: You wanna hangout after school? We can go somewhere happy...like the arcade!

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_HALLWAY_DIALOGUE_MAX06
writing.text: Max: Aw yeah!

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_ARCADE01
writing.text: You are havinga blast in the arcade! There are so many games you love here.

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_ARCADE02
writing.text: What do you want to play next?.

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_ARCADE02_CHOICE01
writing.text: Pac Man.

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_ARCADE02_CHOICE02
writing.text: Dig Dug

writing.name: DAY4_TRANSITION_01_ARCADE03_ASH01
Ash Smiles as you play the games together and talk about school. You notice there seems to be a sigh after slightly looking away as the game ends.
DAY4_TRANSITION_01_ARCADE03_ASH02
You: Have you noticed anything different about Max lately? She's quite jumpy.
DAY4_TRANSITION_01_ARCADE03_ASH03
Ash: Not really, maybe a bit of stress? Were all quite stressed here.
DAY4_TRANSITION_01_ARCADE03_ASH04

Ash steps away from the game and starts going to another one. In that moment, Ash drops a paper. He looks at the clock, says he has to go, waves and rushes out the door before you can hand him the paper
DAY4_TRANSITION_01_ARCADE03_MAX01
Max seems to be a bit sad in the arcade, but she's laughing a lot and you talk about school. She makes several references to the person who used to be her best friend.
DAY4_TRANSITION_01_ARCADE03_MAX02
You:Have you noticed anything different about Ash lately? He's quite jumpy.
DAY4_TRANSITION_01_ARCADE03_MAX03
Max: Not really, maybe a bit of stress? Were all quite stressed here. He seems to be upset all the time though. Might make him seem more popular maybe haha.
DAY4_TRANSITION_01_ARCADE03_MAX04

Max steps away from the game and starts going to another one. In that moment, she drops a paper. Max looks at the clock, says she has to go, waves and rushes out the door before you can hand her the paper
